intro: Calochortus pallidus, commonly known as the pale mariposa lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their showy, often showy, and colorful blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a distinctive, often recurved tepal arrangement. It is a perennial herb that produces a single, upright stem bearing a few to several flowers.
